page.title: 03The Future Of Farming,Alford
page.content: The viability of the area depends on the farming industry which at present is going through a difficult time. Agricultural grants and government policies in food production tempted many farmers to borrow heavily, which is costly. Many now realise that a change in support for rural industries must come and the era of maximum food production is ending.Subsidies to grow food which the market does not need or want makes no sense.Many realise that new policies for supporting rural population will be sought by the government and the E.E.C.Some farmers assert they are sympathetic towards wildlife conservation but this needs to be demonstrated by practical steps. Poor hay and cereal harvests caused by the very wet summer of 1985 may bankrupt some farmers.
